Annotation.String: This schema defines a composed node and its respective properties.
This resource shall be used to represent resources that represent a composed node.
The type of reset to be performed.
This defines the property name for the action.
This action is used to reset the system.

This action shall perform a reset of the ComposedNode. For systems which implement APCI Power Button functionality, the PushPowerButton value shall perform or emulate an ACPI Power Button push. The ForceOff value shall remove power from the system or perform an ACPI Power Button Override (commonly known as a 4-second hold of the Power Button). The ForceRestart value shall perform a ForceOff action followed by a On action. SoftShutdown must be supported on host OS (ACPI feature)
This action is used to assemble the node.
This action shall perform a assemble of the ComposedNode.
This schema defines a node and its respective properties.
This resource shall be used to represent resources that represent a node in the Redfish specification.
Contains links to other resources that are related to this resource.
The user definable tag that can be used to track this computer system for inventory or other client purposes
The value of this property shall contain the value of the asset tag of the system.
The universal unique identifier (UUID) for this system.

The value of this property shall be used to contain a universal unique identifier number for the system. RFC4122 describes methods that can be used to create the value. The value should be considered to be opaque. Client software should only treat the overall value as a universally unique identifier and should not interpret any sub-fields within the UUID. If the system supports SMBIOS, the value and byte order of the property should match byte-for-byte with the memory byte order (from lowest address to highest) of the SMBIOS UUID. Following this order will make it simpler to correlate the UUID with the SMBIOS UUID
This is the current power state of the system.
The value of this property shall contain the power state of the system.
Information about the boot settings for this system.
This object shall contain properties which describe boot information for the current resource.
This is used to specify if TPM module should be cleared on composed node DELETE request.
This is used to specify if TPM module should be cleared on composed node DELETE request.
Reference to ComputerSystem resource used to compose this node.
This property contain reference to ComputerSystem resource used to compose this node.
Array of references to Processor resources
This property contains array of references to Processor resources
Array of references to Memory resources
This property contains array of references to Memory resources
Array of links to Ethernet Interface collection associated with this Composed Node.
This property contains array of links to Ethernet Interface collection associated with this Composed Node.
An array of references to the storage resources used by this composed node.
This property contains array of references to the storage resources connected to this node. It can be direct attached drive, drive attached remotely or remote volume.
This value is not used anymore.
An array of references to Managers responsible for this Composed Node.
This property contains array of references to Managers responsible for this Composed Node.
A composed system.
Allocating resources for node is in progress. Next state can be Allocated or Failed.
Node resources has been allocated, but assembly not started yet. After ComposedNode.Assemble action state will progress to Assembling.
Assembly process initiated, but not finished yet. When assembly is done it will change into Assembled.
Allocation or assembly process failed, or in runtime one of composing components was removed or transitioned in error state.
Node successfully assembled.
Link to resource from attachable pool that should be attached to this node.
This should be used to point to attachable resource that should be connected to this node.
The protocol that should be used to connect this resource.
This defines protocol (fabric) used for connecting device, if multiple for this resource are supported.
This action is used to attach resource (storage drive, volume, endpoint, etc.) to the node.
This action allows attaching poolable resource like remote drive, FPGA, NIC, endpoint etc. to this composed node. Action can be performed when Composed Node is Assembled or Failed.
Link to currently attached resource that should be detached from node.
Link to currently attached resource that should be detached from node.
This action is used to detach resource from the node.
Action used to detach already connected resource. Action can be performed when Composed Node is Assembled or Failed.
This version was created to change references to AttachResource Protocol to use the unversioned definition and to update the description of DetachResource action.
This version was created to add ClearOptaneDCPersistentMemoryOnDelete property to ComposedNode, to add ForceDelete action to the ComposedNode and to deprecate ManagedBy Links.
This property is used to specify if Erase operation should be performed on Optane DC Persistent Memory in a composed node on DELETE request.
This property is used to specify if Erase operation should be performed on Optane DC Persistent Memory in a composed node on DELETE request.
This action is used to force the deletion of a ComposedNode.
This action is used to delete a ComposedNode. If any of the dessemblation and deallocation steps fail, the action still proceeds and all references to the ComposedNode are removed.
